author: quigua
body:
I am not sure, but it is not funny anymore because I see the 12 points every time. Maybe my brain just recorded the pattern and remember it. I can not switch back again.
Also is truth that I work with crystal simetry  pattern daily, so, maybe my brain is trained to see patterns and keep it. Also, in this occasion, I knew what was looking for...
This make me think how different we perceive the universe around us... Even when everybody is seeing the same thing...
title: RE: Can you see all twelve dots in this image?   Nope.... you cannot.

author: quigua
body: At first, I couldn't see more than 4 points at the same time. But, then I follow all points with the eyes making a circle pattern during 15 seconds, and surprising!. I can see the 12 points, and now I can not see the blinking points again. That is  really crazy...
title: RE: Can you see all twelve dots in this image?   Nope.... you cannot.

author: slammr76
body: Right now, Steem has value because you can exchange it for bitcoin. I don't have to exchange bitcoin for fiat for it to have value for me, even though the merchants accepting it are likely exchanging it for fiat. I can and do spend bitcoin all the time. I've never exchanged it for fiat but have always exchanged dollars for bitcoin. I prefer to have my weath stored in bitcoin. Someday, the merchants will, too, and few will care what the exchange rate for bitcoin vs fiat is.
title: RE: Why Are Bitcoin, Steem And Other Cryptocoins Worth "Real" Money?

author: fast2future
body:
@blocktrades Nice to meet you.  You seem cool! :)
I've been following the Steemit community pretty closely for the past few months and I'm very interested in getting involved more.  Specifically, putting all of the 'high school drama' behind (sorry, but I'm just calling it like I've seen it being played out here - I've actually admired your upfront approach and appreciate you posting these posts regardless of the 'flack' lol - it seems that ultimate transparency will be what's best so I applaud you taking this stance here)... what I'm primarily interested in is the ultimate vision.

I really think that when all of us kick our egos to the curb, that we have a community of very bright change makers here.  I believe Steemit could really do something to impact the greater world which is why I'm watching it so closely.

My vision is to help create a world of abundance 4 everyone (whatever that means people can debate, lol)... 

I like to think that I am a little bit like you and 'just call it as it is', no sense of beating around the bush - if the vision is what is attracting and keeping people, resources, and energy engaged it will succeed regardless of any one individual - 

In many ways, Steemit is 'organized chaos' - it really is like all of the nerds from high school who want to change the world all showed up in one place online and now they are trying to figure out what to do next.

I just hope that this experiment continues to flourish because what is being born on the Steemit platform right in front of our eyes is special and I think we all know that.

Life, business, and all that we do as humans is akin to a 'race' (or at least in my mind)... the better you train and prepare, the better you'll run.
And it's a race against TIME - sure, Steemit has an edge being so young and first out of the blocks, but it will take a TEAM to keep renewing the passion and vigor each and everyday to make this reach it's true potential.

I want to know where and how I can follow this discussion.  
And, at this moment in time, I'll gladly be part of this discussion if asked to be.

I just want to see a great thing grow to be something even greater.  That is the potential that I am observing with this community.  

@blocktrades 
Reach out to me via chat sometime if you think I can help in any way.  Or just reach out to say hello - I like to have fun, so make me laugh.  
And when we're not trying to change the world directly with platforms like Steemit, it's fun to talk about things like baseball, family, friends, faith, etc. - the things that matter most.

Long comment here, but just wanted to thank you for your posts here about witnesses and tech stuff.  Thanks for making a stand for what you feel is right.

Stay Strong!

author: smailer
body:
Thank you for you post.
I was have an idea some day before about how to take attention for a newcomers and spread rewards to good one authors who still don't have it.
A agree with your point about findings good articles and collection of they by local group people and local translation.
My idea was in giving a temporal vote power for an group or some users for short time who will make some curation. 
But this vote powed for this period will not allow to user vote for himself and upvote more than twice a day same another author. Curation reward can be splitted between  "whale" and  delegated curator unit.
Also don't allow make power down for delegated curator in this period of time.
By this way lot of local languages issue can be solved also it can help make more  uniform distribution attention to good content.

But it's still just idea I has call it "King for a day" and I have no idea is this possible to realize on the platform. 
Maybe it will be some multiplier coefficient to existing user power or maybe something like "vote power loan".

Anyway I want to make this platform better as many other people who care not about only they  profit.  I know some group peoples who discuss about the ways how to make something better there.
But I don't know the way how to bring idea to the developers or powerful persons on Steemit.
I spend a lot of time on rocket chat and open to discuss.
title: RE: Witness Report for BlockTrades for last week of August

author: sweetsssj
body:
Thanks blocktrades for the insight.

I'm happy to hear that  more user friendly features are being thought about all the time, I find that i've had to use several different sites and plugins to get the kind of experience I would normally expect from a social media site.

Steemd - to view activity 
Steemwhales to view stats 
Steemification to have notifications of activity
esteem for mobile app

I think many of these could be eventually integrated into the main site itself.

Also, I'm happy to hear that you recognise the difficulty which non-native English speakers have in reaching an audience that primarily reads English. Although my native language is Chinese, I think that I've had a little bit more success than my other countrymen because I insist on keeping my posts bi-lingual or even some in full English. The concern is that those who don't have the background to write a full article in both languages will feel disadvantaged and eventually leave. 

I've seen @anwenbaumeister make some some contribution to the chinese community by arranging the translation of some good English articles into Chinese, but there is no such initiative on the contrary.  

A common concern raised in the cn community is that there is a clear barrier of entry to signing up to steemit as a regular Chinese user. As you know, facebook is inaccessible in China, and most users do not have a reddit account let alone one with reputation.  This  is making the propagation of steemit usage in china quite difficult, even amongst the small proportion of English literate users (Which itself is a very large number of people).   I'm sure that when you say 
> The platform should be easier to join.

You have already thought of the issues I've raised regarding Chinese user signup. 

Thanks again for the report and I look forward to reading the next one.
title: RE: Witness Report for BlockTrades for last week of August

author: thecryptofiend
body:
Thanks for the updates.  

It is useful for us to know who the witnesses are and what their thinking is about the platform.  It makes it easier for us to decide who to vote on as witnesses.  My vote doesn't count for much but I only vote for people who I see contributing to the community.

I share your concerns over issue number 323.  I think these things need to be discussed on a more prominent forum than github before they are implemented otherwise it looks like authoritarian control  on a decentralised platform.

I would prefer a special account and channel on Steemit that is purely for platform discussion.  That way there are no accusations of things being hidden until implementation and there is also no confusion with @dantheman's personal posts.

Also thank you for bringing up the issue with the post editor.  This is one of the worst parts of the user experience and frankly I wish I didn't have to use it.   It was a complete nightmare trying to right my most [recent post](https://steemit.com/life/@thecryptofiend/things-i-wish-i-d-known-when-i-was-18) due to the length.  

Which .html editor would you recommend?

Anyway thanks for letting us know what is going on it is appreciated despite other witnesses giving you flack:)
title: RE: Witness Report for BlockTrades for last week of August

author: pcste
body:
I agree. i think steemit needs to be more far more user friendly. ive been involved with p.c.'s and the internet for 20 yrs but had to look for answers when i first joined. because of my experience i knew how to find those answers. A lot of people are not so techy savy and are not particularly wanting to be. they just want to click and go.
I've been on steemit for about 5 weeks now and in that time ive told loads of my friends to get on it. most of them are txting me or fb'ng me to ask simple things like how to post a pic or post in a category. O.K i realise most people have come from the crypto background so are already techy literate, but the fact that it is a social media site means if steemit is to be  successfull it will have a majority of non techy people. 
There really should be a 'sticky' help section. easily seen and accessible.
i know there are plenty of help posts (ive even wrote a few) but they don't get voted up and they quicky get lost in the ether so you have to trawl through too many to find the answers.
And here i think lies the problem. people are posting for value and not to give help. people are trying to write the next post that appeases the whales. The whales don't want to vote up the help posts because they dont want new potential users seeing that the site has issues.
(Was this project launched too early?)

I think there is also a problem with how some whales vote. I can understand that for this site to be successful there has to be a period of major advertising (i did a degree in advertising photography) and i realise that means the devs and the whales want new visitors to hit the site and see steemit sucess stories or advertising, but it seems thats all it is. sucess stories, advertising, what people are doing for steemit, posts by other whales and success stories mainly about steemit and crypto.

There are so many good honest original worthwhile posts on steemit that show so much talent, yet they are getting very little return on the grand scale of things. write something about steemit, crypto, how good steemit is, advertising steemit or crypto big wigs and clebrities and you might get a fortune.

The thing is, the majority of new users are seeing/experiencing these issues very quickly. they are seeing that you potentialy can get rich at first but then quickly get dis-illusioned as mostly their posts get nothing or a few cents, added to the fact that its taken them so much time to make a post because of the lack of user ease.

I think we are at a crucial point atm. Ive been into crypto for 3 years now, starting with the litecoin rush. ive seen so many cryptos come and go, unfortunately this looks like it might fail too if things dont change.
Personally i think the figures speak for themselves. 80,000 registered users but only 4,500 active users today (this figure has been going down) Active last 7 days : 12,768. thats a lot of lost customers.
The price of steem is still falling (incidently its been doing that since i joined when there was about 2,000 users)
Obviously the advertising has been working  and drawn people in but when they've got here they've not done anything (i have friends that joined and still  haven't made a post)
Doesn't that sound a bit strange? you come to the land of milk and honey  where there's free crypto and a way to make more, and you just dont bother? i don't think so. theres obviously a problem.
Like i say, people nowadays like to click and go. they want it simple. they also dont want to see people getting rich off very little skill while they are getting little from their good honest creative talent. they also dont want to continually see the rich getting richer while they get nothing.
I realise thats how capitalism works but at least in capitalism most people make a living. in the steemit system some people get mega rich, some get a living but the majority get nothing.
Once you lose a customer they don't come back usually.

So to the question of where should steemit go next. well in my mind it needs to stop bullying itself self up and kissing its own arse and start being a social media site that rewards its good posters. it needs ease of use. it also could do with some kind of messaging or pm service (what other social media site doesn't allow you to contact each other?)
it needs to decide what its going to be and stick to it.  People dont like the game changing all the time.  (i cant even believe we've had 13 hard forks) Then theres the elite mining system. people like familiarity and useability. plus investors need to see a stable future because of the fragility of previous crypto's.

If steemit doesnt change and whales are just in it for the money then they will be on their own on steemit and the price will continue to fall until they are no richer than the average jo. after all it takes 104 weeks to liquify all assets. by then the price could be 1cent if things carry on the way they are.
If steemit is to succeed then everyone needs to benefit or nobody benefits in the long run.
I do believe steemit still has the potential for so much, it has definitely motivated and inspired me to do more of my artwork. but at the same time im starting to fear it will go like the rest of the crypto's ive been involved in.
However i am in it for the duration and am still posting and curating everyday. I even started the website steembubble.com because i had so much faith.
title: RE: Witness Report for BlockTrades for last week of August

author: halo
body:
|Instead of tweaking the curation system, I'm still advocating for more changes to the front-end of Steemit. This is because I believe that Steem is first and foremost an open, decentralized social media platform and that the user experience is more important than the rewards system. The platform should be easier to join, doing things like adding images, audio, and video should be extremely easy for novice users, the tagging system should work better, there should be more ways for users to interact with each other, there should a clear place on the Steemit site to get help and find information about site usage, and the latest revision of the post editor feels terrible to me (this is the first big post I've made using this version so I hadn't noticed it till now, but ultimately I resorted to editing this post in a separate editor using raw HTML). Everyday billions of people use social media sites that are tightly controlled by the site owners and who pay nothing to their users. If we focus on adding the types of features those sites already have and keep our system open and free, with the chance for rewards, I think we're sitting on a winning combination.|

I completely agree with this. Steemit wants the masses to come but the masses want to do things quick and easy. 
💋 @halo 💋😇

body:
Thank you for posting, as a new user last week.  (I am an expert now)  I was very concerned about a lack of communication from the leadership team.

I don't mind if the price falls, I don't mind if there are bugs in a beta site.

I get really nervous when there are no leaders in site.  This comes from my background as a consultant for Startups.  Leaders are people other people follow, where they wouldn't have gone before.
